questions.question_text:
A DevOps team lead wants the team to be able to automate the rapid delivery of software with increased reliability to support the growth of the business. The
DevOps team is responsible for creating Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines and already uses development tools, such as Jenkins and
Git, so they need a solution to be able to leverage the existing investment in these technologies.
Which vRealize Automation service will enable the DevOps team to meet these requirements?

discussion.content: I believe answer is A, Code Stream.
I think it is A

Selected Answer: A
should be A
A only as it was for POC and moreover there are limited resources.
A, The standard deployment is used only for proof of concept and testing. The clustered deployment is used for production. from the book.

For proof of concept alone just a single node of vRA 8.x would do. Furthermore, the question did mention limited resources. A single node of vRA appliance will take up 12 vCPU and 40GB of RAM

Refer to concurrency max here: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.0/reference-architecture/GUID-9DD443EA-0F7A-43B3-AD0A-8370B56109BE.html
A - is correct
A correct it's clean in th√© course material
Me too, A

questions.question_text:
An administrator is preparing for a proof-of-concept using vRealize Automation to demonstrate the value of self-service automation. Its development environment has limited resources due to other competing projects.
Which type of vRealize Automation deployment should the administrator use when deploying with the vRealize Easy Installer?

choices.D: The vRealize Automation appliance does not have internet access.
choices.C: The required permissions are not granted to view the provisioning diagram.
choices.B: The provisioning diagram is only available for 48 hours post-deployment.
choices.A: The consumer-ui pod is down on the vRealize Automation appliance.

questions.question_text:
While viewing the provisioning diagram for a deployment in vRealize Automation, an administrator receives the following error:
"Could not find any request tasks."
What is a possible cause of this error?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is B - Tested in LAB - VRA Cloud Assembly - Deployments - click on one of them - History - Provision Diagram - then I reproduced the error : 
"Could not find any request tasks, maybe request has expired after '48' hours since it was started."

Think the answer should be B.
But it is actually applicable for vRA 8.3.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.3/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-970CA971-65B7-4747-BF35-A54C1C0B849B.html
The correct answer should be B.

comments.content: Can you please provide reference link for answer B ?

discussion.content:
Read the question gentlemen. "Which user role is required to create an NSX-T Data Center cloud account in vRealize Automation?"

It is A - Cloud Assembly Administrator.
Trick question. the context seems to be which user role "in vRA" to create ... which would be simply A - Cloud Assembly Admin.
Answer is 'A' .. To add a Cloud account .. Cloud administrator privilege is enough

Answer - D :
"Add an NSX-T cloud account
Provide an account with the following read and write privileges:
NSX-T Enterprise Administrator role and access credentials
NSX-T IP address or FQDN"
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.1/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-F58886C2-D5DF-4878-B9F4-515FBB363E4D.html

Answer should be A.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.1/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-5A4C11E3-C7E6-4FBB-BFB3-F85C2FA28D6D.html#GUID-5A4C11E3-C7E6-4FBB-BFB3-F85C2FA28D6D

Answer should be D. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.3/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-F58886C2-D5DF-4878-B9F4-515FBB363E4D.html#GUID-F58886C2-D5DF-4878-B9F4-515FBB363E4D

questions.question_text:
As part of a greenfield deployment, an administrator needs to set up an NSX-T Data Center cloud account.
Which user role is required to create an NSX-T Data Center cloud account in vRealize Automation?

discussion.content: Answer should be D "service broker

Selected Answer: D
Service Broker is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which vRealize Automation service allows an administrator to import released blueprints and Amazon Web Services CloudFormation templates that users can deploy?
